answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Low grade fever is generally due to anemia, diabetes, hypothyroid states, overwork, stress and fatigue. It is also seen in diseases like tuberculosis. Anemia and diabetes can raise the heart rate too.If your stomach too feels queasy, there is a chance that you have inflammation of the bowels as seen in IBS, colitis or maybe even gluten or lactose intolerance. All these can raise heart rate and cause low grade fever. Discuss this with your doctor and try and get investigated.Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
Thank you so much for your response.  It was very kind of you.
Hi.You need some bloods doing, for FBC, Thyroid , Diabetes,etcI had tachycardia, with a thyroid condition, which also gave me a low grade fever also.I would just check it to rule it outNicola

question: I have been having morning episodes of tachycardia, along with a low grade fever intermittently.  My heart rate goes up to around 120, and is usually in the morning after I get up for just a bit.  I went to the doc last week and he thought it was just a virus, but it keeps hanging on, and making me very tired and weak.  The EKG was normal.  does anyone have an idea?  I saw another post, and I am not on birth control, and do not use artificial sweeteners.This discussion is related to/posts/show/200028.
title: low grade fever and tachycardia
